description: Claims are submitted annually and annual payments are largely based on the hectares of land claimed.
title: Single Payment Scheme (SPS) claims

department.title: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

description-extra: The Single Payment Scheme distributes about £2 billion of EU Common Agricultural Funds to farmers in England each year. The service lets users submit claims, update their details and track progress of their claims through to payment.
costs: This figure is based on the Defra/Rural Payments Agency (RPA) methodology. It is the final 2012 to 2013 figure after audit of the agency’s accounts compared to the target Defra/RPA cost per Single Payment Scheme claim figure of £727 that was reported in the RPA Business Plan for 2011 to 2012.
other-notes: The Single Payment Scheme has fewer than 750,000 transactions per year, but is included with high-volume transactions because it has an exceptionally high departmental spend.

modules.title: Total cost
info: This figure is based on the Defra/Rural Payments Agency (RPA) methodology. It is the final 2012 to 2013 figure after audit of the agency’s accounts compared to the target Defra/RPA cost per Single Payment Scheme claim figure of £727 that was reported in the RPA Business Plan for 2011 to 2012.
Data source: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info: This figure is based on the Defra/Rural Payments Agency (RPA) methodology. It is the final 2012 to 2013 figure after audit of the agency’s accounts compared to the target Defra/RPA cost per Single Payment Scheme claim figure of £727 that was reported in the RPA Business Plan for 2011 to 2012.
Data source: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.
